caption: Make sure u gonna make your reservation 6month before your flight to Hawaii cause they have problems with personal 😂🙈. Rude stuff bad experience!

Japanese yakiniku is unmatched 🙌🙌 My favorite is the beef tounge! (kinda basic, I know 😅😅 lol). Their washugyu yukke and washugyu negitoro sushi is delicious. Basically can't go wrong with anything on their menu!
Food was really great there. Price was ok.
Wagyu beef is authentic across U.S., and much cheaper than other places in U.S. mainland. Could have a wagyu bbq feast here. We ordered the wagyu set for 2, two much meat for the two of us 😂
needless to say, it was great food but wonderful customer service! we will be back soon.
Best Wagyu beef

Meat was juicy and tender, and I am very happy about the price with its quality! Definitely go back and try another plate!! I would like to add that Japanese BBQ Yoshi knows how to cook meat to maximize the flavor of meat!
Out of this world! Excellent service and outstanding meat. The Kobe beef is legit.

First night restaurants were allowed to open after covid quarantine. The staff were awesome, the food quality was top notch and they were very considerate of new social distancing requirements.  This place is a definite must for people who like and can appreciate quality.
It tastes so bad and the wagyu is so thin, please lower the price, because it's not worth it!!!!!!!!!!!

Really high quality meat! I was not a fan of the thick beef tongue actually... it didn't really stick out to me. I was hoping it would be like the thick beef tongue I had when I was in Tokyo, but it lacked the "beef tongue" taste. Instead, it was just fatty, in a good, juicy way. I liked all the other meats I tried. I got the yuzu jello thing with watermelon sorbet for dessert and it was sooo good! The jello is too sour on its own, but with the sorbet, it's perfect! Service was good and the server who helped us the most was friendly and patient.
Haven't been here for a while but the food is excellent
(Translated by Google) The volume is amazing  (Original) ボリュームがスゴい
So good for the price!
Food quality is high
Great service and good deals!
The meat is extremely delicious. Wagyu is great. My favorite yakiniku-ya san. But it is very expensive.

Wanted some wagyu and it was awesome! Was in the area for a long weekend and had been wanting to try Wagyu for a while. The waiter was very friendly and extremely patient. He explained all all the different cuts and types of beef to us. We had the wagyu sampler, bibimap, and cucumber kimchee. We loved it!
(Translated by Google) Recommended menu course Loin Throat Yoshi salad chicken hormone Wagyu sampler dessert  (Original) おススメメニュー コース ロース のどもと 吉サラダ チキン ホルモン 和牛サンプラー デザート
Amazing amazing meal! Fabulous service and the best food we've had in Hawaii
I loved the food and the service was great. If you go early for dinner, you can also get really good deals and save alot of money. I was very satisfied with my dining experience here.
Good Japonese, cook your own steak spot. Very expensive cuts of beef, so be prepared! Very attentive staff.
Best food, awesome service.... Going again and again!

Everything was amazing! From the impeccable meat quality of the wagyu to the well designed side dishes to the knowledgable service, the whole experience did not disappoint.  The only negative reviews here are for the price, but it’s well worth it outside of Japan!

We go here for special occasions for quality meat (I'm always for quality over quantity). I'm not a huge fan of fatty meat, but I'll make an exception for ones that melt in your mouth! Wagyu brought in from Japan! Some days are busier than others, we're not sure why, so we always come at near opening time to make sure to beat any rushes and do a walk in. Do not over cook your meat, if you aren't sure, don't be afraid to ask the best way to cook it, their servers are so nice and will gladly give you tips on the best way to cook the meat to perfection. Some say they're small portions, but it's perfect for us. Parking is out front with about 10-12 stalls. Follow them on IG @japanesebbqyoshi and you'll see good deals, make reservations so you won't miss out!

Unreasonably Expensive! We all know Wagyu can cost a lot but talk about nickel and diming. For the amount they charge for their cuts of meat, I should not be charged $4 for a small bowl of rice. Or $6 for some side veggies. Will never come here again, and I recommend everyone stay away.

One of our favorite places to go and eat at. They have two happy hour specials from 5pm -6pm and again at 8:45pm - 10pm but last call is at 9:45. Ch cl out their Instagram page for specials.  Beside some great selection of meats, they also have salads, a nice selection of appetizers, desserts and alcohol. It is best to make reservations as they can get crazy busy and full.
Good quality meat. Highly recommend. Introduced by my Japanese friends. Love it. For the qualioty, it is actually not expensive. Happy hour is excellent value.
Pricey.  Left there still hungry.  Rip off supreme. don't go.
Love the food and customer service. great atmosphere!
Really great food and great service, bit pricy but you get a lot of food.
Their wagyu beef is quite amazing but what sets them apart from other restaurants is their customer service.  Must try for everyone!

(Translated by Google) As I did for Hiroshi Yakiniku, I was very satisfied as Japanese yakiniku. Wagyu is also tasty, but scallop miso butter roasting is excellent even with the remaining miso on vegetables and meat!  (Original) 以前の焼き肉ヒロシと同様、Japanese yakinikuとしてとても満足しました。和牛もおいしいですがホタテの味噌バター焼きは残った味噌を野菜や肉にかけても抜群！
Expensive buy very good
Best Japanese steak you can find
Best quality yakiniku beef on the island and reasonably priced! Also awesome service! Love coming here for special occasions, or date nights.

The food is very good, but expect to spend a lot of money if you eat here. I really liked the wagyu set menu. We were so full, we could not finish all the courses. We ended up taking home some of our food. I also really liked the dessert that came with the set menu; it was very refreshing.
pricey for the selections and quality.
Great food and service! The sampler plate gives you three different types of wagyu beef to try and it is absolutely delectable!
Food was delicious. The service was definitely first class.  Great place to go with family, date, business dinner and hangout with friends.
Yum!

If you're visiting O'ahu and want to try some of the best beef in the world, you have to try Yakiniku Yoshi!  They get Wagyu beef flown in from Japan, and it is so incredibly tender and flavorful.  You definitely get what you pay for.  Be sure to try the sampler so you can try a variety of the different cuts.  I'll definitely be returning on my next vacation to O'ahu.

A friend recommended this place while I was visiting.  Being that I just came back from Japan, my review may not be doing justice, however compared to LA places of similar caliber, I will have to say meat quality falls short.  Particularly the prime kalbi.  While raw, it looked nice and marbely and good, however after it's been cooked on the grill even at medium rare, the meat texture was kinda leathery and dry.  The thick cut tongue was good, but at $36 for 9 pieces, it better.  Oh and rice was $4 a bowl....a bit overpriced for rice.  I'm kinda glad I didn't order the A5 Wagyu like a lot of the Yelp reviews suggested as I think I would likely be disappointed since I already had various cuts of A5 while I was in Japan recently.  Overall, if you're in the mood for yakiniku, I'd suggest coming here for their happy hour deals as it's a descent deal.
The wagyu is always on point.  If you value your taste buds, order a side order of the wasabi sauce and dip your meat in there.  It's glorious.
Fantastic service and select meats! One of the best Yakiniku restaurants in Hawaii, definitely done here especially if celebrating a special occasion.

Yakiniku Yoshi was a great restaurant! The food was amazing, the service was amazing too, and it definitely felt like I was in Hawaii. I would come back here because the food is truly high quality, and you can't get that everywhere.
The wagyu menu is a must try! Only place where I've felt like I've had too much wagyu and thats saying a lot
(Translated by Google) It's so-so. If anything, a yakiniku restaurant run by a Korean  (Original) まあまあですね。どちらかというと韓国系の方が営む焼肉屋
Great kobe, kimchi perfect spot to enjoy with a big group
Waygu to die for. Great atmosphere, friendly and helpful staff. Great selection.

Excellent selection of premium meats. The wagyu nigiri was so melt-in-my-mouth good. Pork jowls were tender and tasty (I learned about them from a friend so I had them again). The rwo of us had our own tongs so we were able to get our meat cooked the way we liked. Servers appeared to check on us throughout our meal and answered our questions. Creme Brule for dessert was a perfect ending.

(Translated by Google) The meat is not tasty, the meat is thinly sliced, the electric grill is not charcoal, and there is no appetizer, the focus is twice the price of the general Korean barbecue. (It seems to be a restaurant that tricks people who have n’t eaten high-quality yakiniku)  (Original) 肉沒入味，肉切的很薄，用電烤爐不是木炭，沒有送前菜，重點是一般韓式烤肉價格的兩倍。 （好像是騙沒吃過高級日式烤肉的人的店）
Clean grills and eating areas. Very knowledgeable and friendly staff that cared about answering questions about food and drink.

I am giving this place five stars because the food and service was excellent. My party and I came shortly after it opened and the staff were on top of everything from taking our orders to refilling our drinks. I was very impressed. We got the A4/A5 set combo and while the menu said it would serve 2 people it really could serve 3 people. There was salad, side dishes, meat, and even dessert at the end. The wagyu just melts in your mouth! For dessert, we got the bread pudding and yuzu jelly. Although the bread pudding was good, oh my goodness that yuzu jelly was so wonderful; nice and refreshing.
Pricey. We were the last ones and it should have been open for 30 more minutes but they closed up and made us pretty uncomfortable. Service was OK but... Still lacking a little bit.

Try "Wagyu Kalbi" then you will understand the Japanese food quality. I also recommend "Tantan Men" which is like Japanese Ramen. If you are a sushi lover, "Beef Nigiri Zukke" might be a discovery. True Wa(和Japanese) gyu (牛beef) is completely different from US or Korean beef. Yoshi and Gyukaku are two only Japanese BBQ restaurants in HI now.  Besides, you can experience a Japanese style electric toilet in the bathroom, by the way.
Highly recommended! 👍
Get the happy hour specials. BYOB on Sunday and Monday.
